text:
How to clean your Mac without using third-party applications
01 Nov 2019, 16:00 by Alexander Bogdanov
Often, free space runs out not only on the iPhone or iPad, but also on the Mac computer - especially if you have a 128 GB SSD under the hood. Many immediately run to third-party applications for help, but firstly, they are often paid, and sometimes developers are cunning, forcing them to buy a new version of the application every time after a major OS update. And secondly, there are ways to clean your Mac with standard operating system tools, and they are available even in macOS High Sierra.



A rag is good, but she won‚Äôt clean the disk for you
How to free up space on a Mac
To access the cleanup menu, follow these steps:

Go to the Apple menu, then "About This Mac"
Go to the ‚ÄúStorage‚Äù tab and click ‚ÄúManage‚Äù




For many, this line is almost completely filled.
You will find yourself in the storage management section. But if earlier its functionality was very limited, then with macOS High Sierra it became possible to delete individual sections - from backups and iTunes files to large documents and mail. And all this in one place - yes, just like in one famous third-party application. And before that, the system itself will offer you the necessary recommendations for keeping the drive clean: for example, enable automatic cleaning of the basket or optimize the storage.



Section ‚ÄúManagement of the storehouse‚Äù
In the ‚ÄúGarbage removal‚Äù menu, you can quickly see the largest files, clean the download folder, and so on. For example, I didn‚Äôt even know that the wedding archive with photos and videos was saved on the computer, which, by the way, occupied almost 100 GB. Given that these files have long been transferred to external drives and the cloud, I do not need them on the computer.



You can‚Äôt even imagine how many extra and large files you have on your Mac.
What else is good to do is to clean the Downloads folder. Yes, do not be surprised, have you looked into it for a long time? I still have last year‚Äôs files and folders of several gigabytes each. Over time, as a rule, you forget about them, but they remain a burden on your hard drive or SSD.
What everyone forgets is the old iTunes device backups. Okay, if there are copies of 3-4 gigabytes, and if 30-40? Previously, you had to open iTunes, select ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù - the ‚ÄúDevices‚Äù tab, and delete backups there already. But now there is such an option in the storage management menu.



Who makes backups on a Mac when iCloud is available? üôÇ
As you can see, the new application for managing the drive is almost in no way inferior to third-party counterparts, while it implements cleaning at the system level without the need to give some applications access to the disk.

We offer to subscribe to our channel in Yandex.Zen. There you can find life hacks that are not on the site.

Mac cleaning on older OS versions
In this case, you can use the forced cleaning of the "Other" section. Here are just examples of data that can be classified by the system in this way:

Documents and various file types, including PDF, doc, PSD
Archives and disk images, including zip, dmg, iso
Different types of personal user data
Temporary files, audio recordings, etc.
User Libraries (Application Support, iCloud Files, etc.)
System Cache (including Safari)
Files that Spotlight cannot recognize ‚Äî for example, a virtual machine‚Äôs hard drive

What we are dealing with seems to have figured out. How to get rid of it? Open Finder, hold cmd + shift + G, and then visit the folders below. Remove everything from them that (in your opinion) does not belong on the Mac.

~ / Downloads
~ / Library / Caches
~ / Documents

Application developers can still use a third-party utility - for example, this one, which clears Xcode service data. It‚Äôs difficult to delete them yourself, here everything happens in a couple of clicks.
In other cases, resorting to the help of applications from other developers to clean the Mac does not make much sense - you can remove everything you need yourself, even if you spend not 30 seconds on it, but a couple of minutes, but save a couple of thousand rubles.
